information.description: Display post-processor shall support input frames in RGB565 for video 1 and 2 pipeline with size 160x120.
Display post-processor shall support input frames in YUYV for video 1 and 2 pipeline with size 176x144.
Display post-processor shall support input frames in RGB32 for video 1 and 2 pipeline with size 160x120.
Display post-processor shall support input frames in YUYV for video 1 and 2 pipeline with size 640x480.
Display post-processor shall support input frames in RGB565 for video 1 and 2 pipeline with size 640x480.
Display post-processor shall support input frames in YUYV for video 1 and 2 pipeline with size 864X480.
Display post-processor shall support input frames in YUYV for video 1 and 2 pipeline with size 1280X720.
The image can be cropped using different crop values using the VIDIOC_S_CROP ioctl. This test verifies the same.
The height and width of the cropped image can be changed using the VIDIOC_S_CROP ioctl. This test verifies the same.

The image can be cropped in the left direction by changing the left co-ordinates and the height and width of the cropped image can be modified using the VIDIOC_S_CROP ioctl. This test verifies the same.

The image can be cropped in the top direction by changing the top co-ordinates and the height and width of the cropped image can be modified using the VIDIOC_S_CROP ioctl. This test verifies the same.

The image can be cropped in both top and left direction by changing the top and left co-ordinates and the height and width of the cropped image can be modified using the VIDIOC_S_CROP ioctl. This test verifies the same.

The image can be cropped in both top and left direction by changing the top and left co-ordinates and the height and width of the cropped image can be modified using the VIDIOC_S_CROP ioctl. This test verifies the same.

The image can be cropped in both top and left direction by changing the top and left co-ordinates and the height and width of the cropped image can be modified using the VIDIOC_S_CROP ioctl. This test verifies the same.

The image can be cropped in both top and left direction by changing the top and left co-ordinates and the height and width of the cropped image can be modified using the VIDIOC_S_CROP ioctl. This test verifies the same.
The rendered image can be up-sampled (scaled) in horizontal direction using the VIDIOC_S_FMT ioctl. This test verifies the same.
The height and width parameters of the rendered image can be changed using the VIDIOC_S_FMT ioctl. This test verifies the same.
The rendered image can be up-sampled (scaled) in horizontal direction and changing the top direction using the VIDIOC_S_FMT ioctl. This test verifies the same.
The rendered image can be up-sampled (scaled) in horizontal direction and changed both top and left direction using the VIDIOC_S_FMT ioctl. This test verifies the same.
The rendered image can be up-sampled (scaled) in horizontal direction and changed both top and left direction using the VIDIOC_S_FMT ioctl. This test verifies the same.
The rendered image can be up-sampled (scaled) in horizontal direction and changed both top and left direction using the VIDIOC_S_FMT ioctl. This test verifies the same.
The rendered image can be up-sampled (scaled) in horizontal direction and changed both top and left direction using the VIDIOC_S_FMT ioctl. This test verifies the same.
The rendered image can be up-sampled (scaled) in horizontal direction and changed both top and left direction using the VIDIOC_S_FMT ioctl. This test verifies the same.
The rendered image can be up-sampled (scaled) in horizontal direction and changed both top and left direction using the VIDIOC_S_FMT ioctl. This test verifies the same.
The rendered image can be up-sampled (scaled) in horizontal direction and changed both top and left direction using the VIDIOC_S_FMT ioctl. This test verifies the same.
The rendered image can be up-sampled (scaled) in horizontal direction and changed both top and left direction using the VIDIOC_S_FMT ioctl. This test verifies the same.
The rendered image can be up-sampled (scaled) in horizontal direction and changed both top and left direction using the VIDIOC_S_FMT ioctl. This test verifies the same.
The rendered image can be up-sampled (scaled) in horizontal direction and changed both top and left direction using the VIDIOC_S_FMT ioctl. This test verifies the same.
The rendered image can be up-sampled (scaled) in horizontal direction and changed both top and left direction using the VIDIOC_S_FMT ioctl. This test verifies the same.
The rendered image can be up-sampled (scaled) in horizontal direction and changed both top and left direction using the VIDIOC_S_FMT ioctl. This test verifies the same.
The rendered image can be up-sampled (scaled) in horizontal direction and changed both top and left direction using the VIDIOC_S_FMT ioctl. This test verifies the same.
The rendered image can be up-sampled (scaled) in horizontal direction and changed both top and left direction using the VIDIOC_S_FMT ioctl. This test verifies the same.
The rendered image can be up-sampled (scaled) in horizontal direction and changed both top and left direction using the VIDIOC_S_FMT ioctl. This test verifies the same.
The rendered image can be up-sampled (scaled) in horizontal direction and changed both top and left direction using the VIDIOC_S_FMT ioctl. This test verifies the same.
The rendered image can be up-sampled (scaled) in horizontal direction and changed both top and left direction using the VIDIOC_S_FMT ioctl. This test verifies the same.
The rendered image can be up-sampled (scaled) in horizontal direction and changed both top and left direction using the VIDIOC_S_FMT ioctl. This test verifies the same.
The rendered image can be up-sampled (scaled) in horizontal direction and changed both top and left direction using the VIDIOC_S_FMT ioctl. This test verifies the same.
The mirroring support can be turned on or enabled on pipeline 1 using VIDIOC_S_OMAP2_MIRROR ioctl. This test verifies the same.
This test is to verfiy if all the following test cases work properly when the mirroring support is enabled for a video pipeline 1.
This test is to verfiy if all the following test cases work properly when the mirroring support is enabled for a video pipeline 1.
This test is to verfiy if all the following test cases work properly when the mirroring support is enabled for a video pipeline 1.
The mirroring support can be turned off or disabled on pipeline 1 using VIDIOC_S_OMAP2_MIRROR ioctl. This test verifies the same.
The mirroring support can be turned on or enabled on pipeline 2 using VIDIOC_S_OMAP2_MIRROR ioctl. This test verifies the same.
This test is to verfiy if all the following test cases work properly when the mirroring support is enabled for a video pipeline 2.
This test is to verfiy if all the following test cases work properly when the mirroring support is enabled for a video pipeline 2.
This test is to verfiy if all the following test cases work properly when the mirroring support is enabled for a video pipeline 2.
The mirroring support can be turned off or disabled on pipeline 1 using VIDIOC_S_OMAP2_MIRROR ioctl. This test verifies the same.
The window position can be changed in the vertical direction using the VIDIOC_S_FMT ioctl. This test verifies the same.
The window position can be changed in the vertical direction using the VIDIOC_S_FMT ioctl. This test verifies the same.
The window position can be changed in the vertical direction using the VIDIOC_S_FMT ioctl. This test verifies the same.
The transparency color key is supported by video driver on LCD device using VIDIOC_OMAP2_COLORKEY_ENABLE ioctl call.

The transparency color key is supported on LCD device and video pipeline streaming. It can be enabled using VIDIOC_OMAP2_COLORKEY_ENABLE ioctl call. The color key value for video source transparency can be configured using VIDIOC_S_OMAP2_COLORKEY ioctl call. This test verifies the same.

The transparency color key is supported by video driver on TV device using VIDIOC_OMAP2_COLORKEY_ENABLE ioctl call. The color key value for video source transparency can be configured using VIDIOC_S_OMAP2_COLORKEY ioctl call. This test verifies the same.

The transparency color key is supported on TV device. It can be enabled using VIDIOC_OMAP2_COLORKEY_ENABLE ioctl call. The color key value for video source transparency can be configured using VIDIOC_S_OMAP2_COLORKEY ioctl call.

The transparency color key is supported on TV device. It can be enabled using VIDIOC_OMAP2_COLORKEY_ENABLE ioctl call. The color key value for video source transparency can be configured using VIDIOC_S_OMAP2_COLORKEY ioctl call.

The transparency color key is supported on TV device. It can be enabled using VIDIOC_OMAP2_COLORKEY_ENABLE ioctl call. The color key value for video source transparency can be configured using VIDIOC_S_OMAP2_COLORKEY ioctl call.
This test is to verify that the input image is displayed with 90 degree orientation.
This test is to verify that the input image is displayed with 180 degree orientation.
This test is to verify that the input image is displayed with 270 degree orientation.
The Video-1 pipeline can be connected to TV. This test case verfies the same.
The Video-2 pipeline can be connected to TV. This test case verfies the same.
Simultaneously the same input image can be rendered on to both the pipelines using the VIDIOC_S_OMAP2_LINK ioctl. Both the pipelines can be connected to LCD.
Simultaneously the same input image can be rendered on to both the pipelines using the VIDIOC_S_OMAP2_LINK ioctl. Both the pipelines can be connected to TV.
Simultaneously the same input image can be rendered on to both the pipelines using the VIDIOC_S_OMAP2_LINK ioctl. The pipelines can be connected to either TV or LCD.
DSS pipelines shall be capable of being assigned dynamically to either LCD or TV-out, this test verifies the same in video pipeline 1.
DSS pipelines shall be capable of being assigned dynamically to either LCD or TV-out, this test verifies the same in video pipeline 2.
The background color of the canvas can be configured using the VIDIOC_S_OMAP2_BGCOLOR ioctl.
Verify that the Video pipeline can be 'suspended' or 'resumed' properly when called to do so through sysfs.
Same as mentioned in test case ID L_DD_VIDEO_0013_0001. This test verifies the same but different values are used for gfx_global_alpha and vid2_global_alpha.
Same as mentioned in test case ID L_DD_VIDEO_0013_0001. This test verifies the same but different values are used for gfx_global_alpha and vid2_global_alpha.
Enable the global alpha blending and set a global alpha value for the video 2 pipeline on TV device.
Enable the global alpha blending and set a global alpha value for the video 2 pipeline on TV device.
Disable the global alpha blending and set a global alpha value for the video 2 pipeline on TV device.
Horizontal down scaling in a factor of 1/2 with HW decimation.
Horizontal down scaling in a factor of 1/4 with HW decimation.
Vertical down scaling in a factor of 1/2 with HW decimation.
Vertical down scaling in a factor of 1/4 with HW decimation.
Horizontal & Vertical down scaling in a factor of 1/2.
Horizontal & vertical down scaling in a factor of 1/4 with HW decimation.
Horizontal up scaling in a factor of 1.5 with HW decimation.
Horizontal up scaling in a factor of 2 with HW decimation.
Vertical up scaling in a factor of 1.5 with HW decimation.
Vertical up scaling in a factor of 2 with HW decimation.
Horizontal & vertical up scaling in a factor of 1.5 with HW decimation.
Horizontal & vertical up scaling in a factor of 2 with HW decimation
Horizontal up scaling to 1.5 and vertical down scaling to 0.5 with HW decimation.
Vertical up scaling to 1.5 and Horizontal down scaling to 0.5 with HW decimation.

Display driver shall support SDMA based decimation for each video pipeline with the independent decimation factor of 1/5 along each axis and it shall choose appropriate factor depending upon overall downscaling requested and maximum that display subsystem supports for each video pipeline.

Display driver shall support SDMA based decimation for each video pipeline with the independent decimation factor of 1/6 along each axis and it shall choose appropriate factor depending upon overall downscaling requested and maximum that display subsystem supports for each video pipeline.

Display driver shall support SDMA based decimation for each video pipeline with the independent decimation factor of 1/7 along each axis and it shall choose appropriate factor depending upon overall downscaling requested and maximum that display subsystem supports for each video pipeline.

Display driver shall support SDMA based decimation for each video pipeline with the independent decimation factor of 1/8 along each axis and it shall choose appropriate factor depending upon overall downscaling requested and maximum that display subsystem supports for each video pipeline.

Display driver shall support SDMA based decimation for each video pipeline with the independent decimation factor of 1/10 along each axis and it shall choose appropriate factor depending upon overall downscaling requested and maximum that display subsystem supports for each video pipeline.

Display driver shall support SDMA based decimation for each video pipeline with the independent decimation factor of 1/18 along each axis and it shall choose appropriate factor depending upon overall downscaling requested and maximum that display subsystem supports for each video pipeline.
LCD driver shall support the SPI 16-bits interface mode when the subLCD controller is connected to SPI interface.
Display driver shall support configuration of NTSC and PAL Widescreen Signalling settings for TV Out.
TVOut driver shall support notification of TV signal detection events to its clients.
TVOut driver shall support Enable of TV signal detection events when requested by its clients on LCD device.
TVOut driver shall support Disable of TV signal detection events when requested by its clients on LCD device.
TVOut driver shall support Enable of TV signal detection events when requested by its clients on TV device.
TVOut driver shall support Enable of TV signal detection events when requested by its clients on TV device.
LCD driver shall allow DVFS during data transfer.
Display post-processor shall support upto WVGA-Portrait (480x854) & WVGA (854x480) size input frames for video1, video2 pipeline.
Device driver (including any DFCs/DPCs) shall ensure thread safety against scheduler preemption using kernel locks or mutexes.
